webwork-tex.statement:
Match the given equation with the verbal description of the surface: \begin{enumerate} \item[A.] Elliptic or Circular Paraboloid \item[B.] Cone \item[C.] Half plane \item[D.] Plane \item[E.] Sphere \item[F.] Circular Cylinder \end{enumerate}
\par\begin{enumerate} \item[\mbox{\parbox[t]{3ex}{\hrulefill}}1.] \(\phi = \frac{\pi}{3}\) \item[\mbox{\parbox[t]{3ex}{\hrulefill}}2.] \(\rho = 4\) \item[\mbox{\parbox[t]{3ex}{\hrulefill}}3.] \(r =4\) \item[\mbox{\parbox[t]{3ex}{\hrulefill}}4.] \(\rho \cos(\phi )= 4\) \item[\mbox{\parbox[t]{3ex}{\hrulefill}}5.] \(\theta = \frac{\pi}{3}\) \item[\mbox{\parbox[t]{3ex}{\hrulefill}}6.] \(\rho = 2\cos(\phi )\) \item[\mbox{\parbox[t]{3ex}{\hrulefill}}7.] \(r^2 + z^2 =16\) \item[\mbox{\parbox[t]{3ex}{\hrulefill}}8.] \(r = 2\cos(\theta )\) \item[\mbox{\parbox[t]{3ex}{\hrulefill}}9.] \(z = r^2\) \end{enumerate}
